sentences.en: Aren't I a bit long in the tooth to start being an undergraduate?
sentences.cn: 我现在才去读大学本科不是有点太老了吗？

sentences.en: Does that make them any different than undergraduate programs at national universities?
sentences.cn: 是否这样使之与其他国立学校的本科教育产生差异?

sentences.en: During this time, they are called undergraduate students.
sentences.cn: 在此期间, 他们被称为大学本科生.

sentences.en: For example, Harvard College is the undergraduate part of Harvard University.
sentences.cn: 例如, 哈佛学院就是哈佛大学的本科部分.

sentences.en: Hale, who had learned the approved view as an undergraduate, contradicted him.
sentences.cn: 赫尔在大学时代学过当时公认的看法, 因此提出驳斥.

sentences.en: Indeed, most elite universities don't even have an undergraduate business program.
sentences.cn: 的确, 多数名牌大学甚至不开设本科生的商科课程.

sentences.en: Instruction in these subjects in undergraduate classes is almost exclusively by lecture.
sentences.cn: 本科生的这几门课程几乎完全是通过讲座教授的。

sentences.en: Its pay and full - time are common college undergraduate course is same.
sentences.cn: 其待遇与 全日制 普通高校本科一样.

sentences.en: Mr Cook, I've learned very much from your talk about the university requirements for undergraduate students.
sentences.cn: 库克先生, 关于大学本科生的要求我向您了解了许多.

sentences.en: Randy earned his undergraduate degree in Computer Science at Brown in 1982.
sentences.cn: 兰迪在1982年获得了布莱恩大学的计算机科学的本科学位.

sentences.en: She had an undergraduate degree in psychology.
sentences.cn: 她有心理学的学士学位.

sentences.en: The existing 56 full - time professional education, undergraduate professional 26 students nationwide.
sentences.cn: 现有56个 全日制 普通教育专业, 其中本科专业26个,面向全国招生.

sentences.en: The human brains behind this artificial brain are two undergraduate students.
sentences.cn: 这个人工智能程序的发明者是两个本科学生.

sentences.en: These particular photographs were taken during an undergraduate laboratory session.
sentences.cn: 这些具体的照片是在实验室中学生做实验时拍摄的.

sentences.en: Undergraduate degree from an accredited university, college or hotel school.
sentences.cn: 高等教育水平,比如大学 、 高等学院或酒店学校等.

phrases.tran_cn: 大学本科；颁发学士学位的学院

trans.tran_cn: 本科生，（未获学士学位的）大学生，大学肄业生
trans.tran_en: a student at college or university, who is working for their first degree
